Package cat.nyaa.nyaacore.timer

Class TimerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • cat.nyaa.nyaacore.configuration.FileConfigure
      • cat.nyaa.nyaacore.timer.TimerManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISerializable
    public class TimerManager
extends FileConfigure
    The timers works similar to runTaskLater or runTaskTimer. Except it's based on real time rather than ticks and is more flexible about server downtime.

    A timer can be DETACHED and/or PAUSED DETACHED: A timer is DETACHED when TimerManager doesn't know what's the timer's callback function. This may because the server has just started and plugin hasn't register the callback yet. When the server is down, all timers are DETACHED PAUSED: A timer is PAUSED when it's not counting time. A timer can be NOT PAUSED even when the server is down. //TODO: use bukkit events instead of callbacks

      • registerTimer

        public void registerTimer​(JavaPlugin plugin,
                          String timerName,
                          TimerData timerData,
                          ITimerCallback callback,
                          ITimerCallback timerResetCallback)
        Timers are uniquely distinguished by plugin & timerName. This method link the existing or newly created timer to the callback function.
        Parameters:
        plugin - the plugin the timer belongs to
        timerName - the timer name, usually plugin specific
        timerData - the timer data & parameters, only for newly created timers. for existing timers, you should leave it to null otherwise exception will be thrown
        callback - the callback object for the timer.
